poem:
**The Loss**

£320m 
in flights and promises,
a journey never taken.

Rwanda dreams of futures
built on the hopes 
of distant shores—

but this Thursday, 
ballots may scatter,
leaving ash and 
disappointment
on both sides 
of the world.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "More than £320m spent on Rwanda policy will be lost if Tories lose election More than £320m spent by the government on the controversial scheme to send asylum seekers to Rwanda is likely to be lost if the Conservatives are voted out of power at Thursday’s general election. The sum has been spent on economic development money for Rwanda, along with set-up costs for the scheme, which cannot be recovered if it does not go". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
